alert.note: Alert for McLennan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 26 at 7:20PM CDT until April 26 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Texas, including the following counties, Hill, Limestone and McLennan. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water on roadways is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waco, Hewitt, Robinson, Bellmead, Woodway, Lacy-Lakeview, McGregor, West, Mart, Beverly Hills, Lorena, Bruceville-Eddy, Moody, Riesel, Crawford, Golinda, Hallsburg, Northcrest, Lake Waco and Tradinghouse Creek Reservoir.
info.instruction: Remain alert to the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning.
